page.title: 06Sheep and Goats
page.content: Athough this part of the moor is used mainly as an artillary range some farming still takes place. This is usually{sheep farming,}though some goats are in evidence. The sheep are mainly raised for meat, except in the lower parts of the area where some wool sheep are to be found. Unusually for this country, and for Dartmoor one can see examples of {Jacobs Sheep}on the lower parts of {High Down.}The Jacobs Sheep are characterised by the foreward pointing horns. Unless one looks carefully it would be easy to confuse a Jacobs with a goat, they have similar characteristics. Sheep are found all over the moor, but cattle are also raised here. At one time rabbits were raised in warrens in order to provide meat for the tinners.
